a boat, esp. one that is large enough to travel on the sea: a cruise/cargo ship
A ship is also an aircraft or spacecraft.
to transport something or someone by air, train, boat, or truck: They shipped our furniture from Tennessee. Parts for the space station are being shipped out there by spacecraft. Phrasal verb
ship someone/something off
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ]
  TRANSPORT, COMMERCE to send or transport something by sea: ship sth to sb/sth The vessel was used to ship gold bullion to America.
[ I or T ]
  TRANSPORT, COMMERCE to send goods by air, train, or road, or to be sent in this way: ship sth to sb/sth The company will ship purchases to any address within the US. I asked the suppliers to ship us a replacement as soon as possible. We don't currently ship outside the EU. They assured me our order will be shipping tomorrow.
[ I or T ]
  COMMERCE, IT to make something, especially computer products and equipment, available for sale, or to become available: The company is now shipping the first in a new series of interactive DVDs. This software has been shipping for a while now.
